sen.j: 武家政権（ぶけせいけん）とは武家による政権である。
sen.e: The military government is an administration under the control of samurai.
The military government was an administration under the control of samurai.
The military government was an administration under the control of samurai.

sen.j: 武士政権（ぶしせいけん）とも呼ぶ。
sen.e: It is also referred as to "Samurai government."
It is also referred to as "Samurai government."
It is also referred to as "Samurai government."

sen.j: 一般には、12世紀後半の源頼朝による鎌倉幕府の設立から、慶応3年（1867年）の徳川慶喜による大政奉還まで、約700年間に渡る武家による政権を指すが、現在は平清盛の平氏政権からとする説が有力である。
sen.e: The military government is an administration under the control of samurai, which continued for about 700 years from the establishment of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in the late 12th century to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) lead by Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in 1867; however, a theory, in which the start was the Taira clan government ruled by TAIRA no Kiyomori, is now widely accepted.

The military government was an administration under the control of samurai, which continued for about 700 years from the establishment of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in the late 12th century to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) lead by Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in 1867; however, a theory, in which the start was the Taira clan government ruled by TAIRA no Kiyomori, is now widely accepted.

The military government was an administration under the control of samurai, which continued for about 700 years from the establishment of the Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo in the late 12th century to Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) lead by Yoshinobu TOKUGAWA in 1867; however, a theory, in which the start was the Taira clan government ruled by TAIRA no Kiyomori, is now widely accepted.

sen.j: そのうち鎌倉、室町、徳川の各武家権力は、武力により政権を樹立し、源頼朝が確立したが、形式上朝廷から任ぜられる形で征夷大将軍の位に付く事で幕府を開き、封建制とも呼ばれる分権的な統治を行い、地方領主として地域の実効支配権を持つ武士の連合政権の形をとった。
sen.e: Of all administrations in the military government, each samurai authority of Kamakura, Muromachi, and Tokugawa was set up by force and established by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo; he started the bakufu by arriving in power of seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in the form of being entrusted by the Imperial Court, achieved decentralized governance, called "feudal system," and adopted a form of coalition government of samurai who had an authority of his region as a local feudal lord.

Of all administrations in the military government, each samurai authority of Kamakura, Muromachi, and Tokugawa were set up by force and could be traced back to the establishment by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo; he started the bakufu by arriving in power of seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in the form of being entrusted by the Imperial Court, achieved decentralized governance, called a "feudal system," and adopted a form of coalition government of samurai who held sway over their region as a local feudal lord.

Of all administrations in the military government, each samurai authority of Kamakura, Muromachi, and Tokugawa were set up by force and could be traced back to the establishment by MINAMOTO no Yoritomo; he started the bakufu by arriving in power of seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in the form of being entrusted by the Imperial Court, achieved decentralized governance, called a "feudal system," and adopted a form of coalition government of samurai who held sway over their region as a local feudal lord.

sen.j: 室町、徳川幕府では征夷大将軍の位は君主家たる将軍家の男児に代々世襲された。
sen.e: The position of seii taishogun was passed to boys of the families positioned to accede to the shogunate of the monarchy for generations in the Muromachi bakufu and the Tokugawa shogunate.
The position of seii taishogun was passed on to male heirs of the families positioned to accede to the shogunate of the monarchy in the Muromachi bakufu and the Tokugawa shogunate.
The position of seii taishogun was passed on to male heirs of the families positioned to accede to the shogunate of the monarchy in the Muromachi bakufu and the Tokugawa shogunate.

sen.j: 武家政権とはかならずしも幕府と同一ではなく、幕府開設以外の方法で武家政権の確立を目指した例もある。
sen.e: It was not necessarily the case that the military government was the identical authority of the bakufu; in fact, there were some cases where a military government would be established by other than establishing a bakufu.

It was not always the case that the military government was the identical authority of the bakufu; in fact, there were some cases where a military government would be established through means other than that of establishing a bakufu.

It was not always the case that the military government was the identical authority of the bakufu; in fact, there were some cases where a military government would be established through means other than that of establishing a bakufu.

sen.j: それには平氏政権・織豊政権が挙げられる。
sen.e: Examples of the cases include the Taira clan government and the Shokuho government (the government of Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI. "Shoku" and "ho" are the initial letters of Oda and Toyotomi).
Examples include the Taira clan government and the Shokuho government (the government of Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI. "Shoku" and "ho" are the initial letters of Oda and Toyotomi).
Examples include the Taira clan government and the Shokuho government (the government of Nobunaga ODA and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI. "Shoku" and "ho" are the initial letters of Oda and Toyotomi).

sen.j: 平氏政権は天皇の外戚として政権確立を指向した。
sen.e: The Taira clan government demanded an establishment of authority as a maternal relative of the Emperor.
The Taira clan government demanded an establishment of authority as a maternal relative of the Emperor.
The Taira clan government demanded an establishment of authority as a maternal relative of the Emperor.

sen.j: 織豊政権は戦国大名の統治機構を母体とする強力な中央集権体制であり、その裏づけに天皇・朝廷の権威を利用するという形式を執った。
sen.e: The Shokuho government was a strong centralized administrative framework whose parent structure was the governing system of daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, and in support of the structure, the government took advantage of authorities of the Emperor and the Imperial Court.

The Shokuho government was a strong centralized administrative framework whose parent structure was the governing system of daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, and to support the structure, the government took advantage of authorities of the Emperor and the Imperial Court.

The Shokuho government was a strong centralized administrative framework whose parent structure was the governing system of daimyo (Japanese territorial lord) in the Sengoku Period, and to support the structure, the government took advantage of authorities of the Emperor and the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 武家政権の誕生以前の日本は、天皇親政、摂関政治、院政など、主に皇族や公家から構成される朝廷機構の中枢から、官人身分の国司を全国に派遣して統治が行われていた。
sen.e: In the pre-military government era in Japan, the Imperial Court mechanism, which included the Emperor's direct rule, the government of regents and advisers, and the cloister government and were formed mainly with Imperial families and Court nobles, supported the nucleus of the administration, and thus provincial governors who had authorities of government official were sent all over Japan to rule the nation.

In the pre-military government era in Japan, the Imperial Court mechanism, which included the Emperor's direct rule, the government of regents and advisers, and the cloister government and were formed mainly with Imperial families and Court nobles, supported the nucleus of the administration, and thus provincial governors who had authorities of government official were sent all over Japan to rule the nation.

In the pre-military government era in Japan, the Imperial Court mechanism, which included the Emperor's direct rule, the government of regents and advisers, and the cloister government and were formed mainly with Imperial families and Court nobles, supported the nucleus of the administration, and thus provincial governors who had authorities of government official were sent all over Japan to rule the nation.

sen.j: 特に律令制に基づいて統治が行われた奈良時代は、古代からの地方首長の末裔である郡司層の首長権に由来する権威を利用しつつ、国司四等官の主催する国衙機構が、戸籍を編纂して朝廷の統治領域全体に個別の人別支配の網を張り巡らしていた。
sen.e: Especially in the Nara period when the nation was governed based on the Ritsuryo system, the system of kokuga (the region the provincial governor of the Ritsuryo system ruled), which was managed by kokushi shitokan (four officials of the provincial governor), extended individual dominance by person throughout areas ruled by the Imperial court by preparing census while taking advantage of authorities originated from chieftaincy of the Gunji (local magistrates) who were scion of the regional chiefs.

Especially in the Nara period when the nation was governed based on the Ritsuryo system, the system of kokuga (the region the provincial governor of the Ritsuryo system ruled), which was managed by kokushi shitokan (four officials of the provincial governor), extended individual dominance by person throughout areas ruled by the Imperial court by preparing census while taking advantage of authorities originated from chieftaincy of the Gunji (local magistrates) who were scion of the regional chiefs.

Especially in the Nara period when the nation was governed based on the Ritsuryo system, the system of kokuga (the region the provincial governor of the Ritsuryo system ruled), which was managed by kokushi shitokan (four officials of the provincial governor), extended individual dominance by person throughout areas ruled by the Imperial court by preparing census while taking advantage of authorities originated from chieftaincy of the Gunji (local magistrates) who were scion of the regional chiefs.

sen.j: しかし平安時代になるころから地域社会での階層分化が激しく進み、資本となる動産を蓄積し、安定経営を成し遂げた少数の富豪百姓が、経営が破綻して口分田を失った零細百姓層を隷属下に収めていく動きが激しくなっていった。
sen.e: However, starting from about the Heian period, the rank differentiation was developed dramatically in the regional society, and a small number of rich peasants, who had accumulated movable assets which could be capital and achieved a stable management, enslaved poor peasants who had lost their kubunden (the farm land given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system) due to failed management more than ever.

However, starting from about the Heian period, the rank differentiation was developed dramatically in regional society, and actions by a small number of rich peasants, who had accumulated movable assets and achieved stable business to enslave poor peasants who had lost their kubunden (the farm land given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system) due to failed management became more popular.

However, starting from about the Heian period, the rank differentiation was developed dramatically in regional society, and actions by a small number of rich peasants, who had accumulated movable assets and achieved stable business to enslave poor peasants who had lost their kubunden (the farm land given to each farmer in the Ritsuryo system) due to failed management became more popular.

sen.j: そのため、国衙機構が戸籍に基づく人別支配をし、なおかつ中央政権の維持に必要な税の徴収を行うことは困難となった。
sen.e: Therefore, the system of kokuga executed dominance by person based on the census and it became difficult to collect tax for maintaining the central government, and accordingly, the system of the dynasty state, in which the heads of the provincial governors (Zuryo) who had been sent to each region received much stronger empowerment than his previous generation and ruled the region and collected tax through the rich peasants, was established in the 10th century.

Therefore, the system of kokuga executed dominance by person based on the census and it became difficult to collect tax to maintain the central government. As a result a system of the dynasty state was established in the 10th century, in which the heads of the provincial governors (Zuryo) who had been sent to each region received much stronger empowerment than their previous generation and ruled the region and collected tax through the rich peasants.
Therefore, the system of kokuga executed dominance by person based on the census and it became difficult to collect tax to maintain the central government.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 現地派遣の筆頭国司（受領）が前代より大幅に権限委譲された上で、富豪百姓層を通じて地域支配、税の徴収を行う王朝国家体制が10世紀に確立した。
sen.e: As a result a system of the dynasty state was established in the 10th century, in which the heads of the provincial governors (Zuryo) who had been sent to each region received much stronger empowerment than their previous generation and ruled the region and collected tax through the rich peasants.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: この新しい体制下で、国衙軍制を担う戦士として、武士身分が成立した。
sen.e: Under this new system, samurai status was established as warriors who would manage the kokuga forces system.
Under this new system, samurai were established as warriors who would manage the kokuga forces system.
Under this new system, samurai were established as warriors who would manage the kokuga forces system.

sen.j: 国衙軍制と武士身分が確立する過程で、初期の武士が自分たちの地位確立を目指して行った条件闘争が武装蜂起にまで拡大し、平将門と藤原純友らによる承平天慶の乱に至った。
sen.e: Through the process of the establishment of the kokuga forces system and the samurai status, the conditional strike, which was originally started by the first samurai to establish their position, extended to an armed uprising, resulting in the Johei-Tengyo Revolt fought between FUJIWARA no Sumitomo and TAIRA no Masakado eventually.

Through the process of the establishment of the kokuga forces system and the samurai status, the conditional strike, which was originally started by the first samurai to establish their position, turned into an armed uprising, resulting in the Johei-Tengyo Revolt fought between FUJIWARA no Sumitomo and TAIRA no Masakado.

Through the process of the establishment of the kokuga forces system and the samurai status, the conditional strike, which was originally started by the first samurai to establish their position, turned into an armed uprising, resulting in the Johei-Tengyo Revolt fought by FUJIWARA no Sumitomo and TAIRA no Masakado.
sen.cmt: between→by原文の意味に合うように修正

sen.j: この乱は短期間で鎮圧されたが、この渦中に平将門は坂東諸国の国衙機構を掌握して「新皇」を称しており、これを武家政権の先駆とする見方もある。
sen.e: During this revolt, which was suppressed in a short period of time, TAIRA no Masakado took control of the system of kokuga in the countries in Bando and called himself "new emperor," which is considered to be the beginning of the military government by some people.

During this revolt, which was suppressed in a short period of time, TAIRA no Masakado took control of the system of kokuga in the countries in Bando and called himself "new emperor," which is considered to be the beginning of the military government by some people.

During this revolt, which was suppressed in a short period of time, TAIRA no Masakado took control of the system of kokuga in the countries in Bando and called himself 'new emperor,' which is considered to be the beginning of the military government by some people.

sen.j: さらに11世紀に荘園公領制が成立すると、対等な権利主体となった荘園と公領（国衙領）の間に武力紛争が多発し、荘園の現地管理者である荘官、公領の現地管理者である惣司、郡司、郷司、保司には武芸の家の者たる武士が任命されるようになった。
sen.e: Furthermore, after the shoen koryo sei (the system of public lands and private estates) was established in the 11th century, many armed conflicts arose between shoen and koryo (Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office)), and accordingly, Shokan (an officer governing shoen (manor)) who were regional managers of shoen, Soji (a local government official under the ritsuryo system), Gunji (local magistrates), Goji (a local government official under the ritsuryo system), and Hoji (an officer governing koryo, or public land), all of whom were regional managers of koryo, were assigned from samurai form military art families.

Furthermore, after the shoen koryo sei (the system of public lands and private estates) was established in the 11th century, many armed conflicts arose between shoen and koryo (Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office)), and accordingly, Shokan (an officer governing shoen (manor)) who were regional managers of shoen, Soji (a local government official under the ritsuryo system), Gunji (local magistrates), Goji (a local government official under the ritsuryo system), and Hoji (an officer governing koryo, or public land), all of whom were regional managers of koryo, were assigned from samurai form military art families.

Furthermore, after the shoen koryo sei (the system of public lands and private estates) was established in the 11th century, many armed conflicts arose between the owners of shoen (private estates) and the administrators of koryo (public land, also known as kokugaryo, meaning territory governed by a provincial government office), both of whom now had equal rights; accordingly, Soji (local government officials under the ritsuryo system), Gunji (local magistrates), Goji (local government officials under the ritsuryo system), and Hoji (officers who managed koryo), all of whom were regional administrators of koryo, and Shokan (officers who managed shoen) were all appointed from samurai families.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを修正しました。

sen.j: こうして武士は地方領主化して地域の実効支配者としての地位を築いていった。
sen.e: In this way, as samurai turned into local feudal lords, they gradually established the position as effective controllers of each area.
In this way, as samurai turned into local feudal lords, they gradually became established as effective controllers of each area.
In this way, as samurai turned into local feudal lords, they gradually became established as effective controllers of each area.

sen.j: 平安時代末期、平清盛が武家としては初めての太政大臣に任じられた。
sen.e: At the end of Heian period, TAIRA no Kiyomori was appointed Grand Minister for the first time from a samurai family.
At the end of Heian period, TAIRA no Kiyomori was appointed Grand Minister for the first time from a samurai family.
At the end of Heian period, TAIRA no Kiyomori was appointed Grand Minister for the first time from a samurai family.

sen.j: 清盛は朝廷の内紛に起因する保元の乱と平治の乱で、武功を挙げ政権を獲得したが、平氏政権は平家一門で朝廷の官位を占め、清盛自身は天皇の外戚となるなど、従来の摂関政治と大差は無かった。
sen.e: Kiyomori gained the administration by achieving military exploits in the Hogen Revolt and the Heiji Revolt; however, the Taira clan government was not much different from the traditional regency, as seen in the facts that the Taira clan occupied most of the official ranks of the Imperial Court and Kiyomori himself became a maternal relative of the Emperor.

Kiyomori gained the administration by achieving military exploits in the Hogen Revolt and the Heiji Revolt; however, the Taira clan government was not much different from the traditional regency, as seen in the fact that the Taira clan occupied most of the official ranks of the Imperial Court and Kiyomori himself became a maternal relative of the Emperor.

Kiyomori gained political power as a result of his military exploits in the Hogen Revolt and the Heiji Revolt, both of which arose as a result of internal conflicts in the Imperial Court; however, the Taira government was not very different from a traditional regency, as can be seen by the fact that the Taira clan occupied most of the official ranks of the Imperial Court, and Kiyomori himself became a maternal relative of the Emperor.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを修正しました。NR: I think "Taira government" is more natural than "Taira clan government".

sen.j: 武家の政治体制をどうするかが発見できず旧来の政治を行い、その中での平氏一門の贅沢な暮らしや異様な出世、繁栄の誇示などするだけになったのである。
sen.e: Kiyomori did not know how to manage the political system of samurai families and thus carried out old-fashioned politics, in which the luxury life style of, and excessive career success and prosperity of the Taira clan were shown off.

Kiyomori did not know how to manage the political system of samurai families and thus carried out old-fashioned politics, showing off the luxurious life style, excessive career success and prosperity of the Taira clan.

Kiyomori did not know how to manage the political system of samurai families and thus carried out old-fashioned politics, showing off the luxurious life style, excessive career success and prosperity of the Taira clan.

sen.j: そのため、地方の実効支配者としての地位の向上を望む多数の地方武士の利益代表者の位置を十分構築できず、同時多発反乱の中から台頭した源義仲や源頼朝らによって滅ぼされた（ただし、清盛が設置した諸制度の中に後の頼朝政権に引き継がれた組織の萌芽が見られるというのが近年の有力説である）。
sen.e: For this reason, the position of beneficial representatives among many local samurai who were hoping to improve their ranks as regional effective controllers was not established sufficiently and the Taira clan was overthrown by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, who gained the power through many simultaneous revolts (However, a recent theory says that germination of the organizations which were taken over to Yoritomo administration can be seen in the various systems established by Kiyomori).

For this reason, the position of beneficial representatives among many local samurai who were hoping to improve their ranks as regional effective controllers was not sufficiently established and the Taira clan was overthrown by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, who gained power through many simultaneous revolts (However, a recent theory says that germination of the organizations which were taken over to Yoritomo administration can be seen in the various systems established by Kiyomori).

For this reason, the position of beneficial representatives among many local samurai who were hoping to improve their ranks as regional effective controllers was not sufficiently established and the Taira clan was overthrown by MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka and MINAMOTO no Yoritomo, who gained power through many simultaneous revolts (However, a recent theory says that germination of the organizations which were taken over to Yoritomo administration can be seen in the various systems established by Kiyomori).

sen.j: 本格的な武家政権は、源頼朝が鎌倉幕府を開いた事により始まる。
sen.e: The full-scale military government started when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo established the Kamakura bakufu.
The full-scale military government started when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo established the Kamakura bakufu.
The full-scale military government started when MINAMOTO no Yoritomo established the Kamakura bakufu.

sen.j: 頼朝は、当初国衙の主として朝廷公家に追い使われていた東国武士集団反乱の旗手として登場する。
sen.e: Yoritomo appeared as a flagman of the revolts of samurai groups in the eastern countries, who was originally serving a court noble of the Imperial Court as a lord of kokuga.
Yoritomo appeared as a flagman in revolts by samurai groups in the eastern countries, who originally served as court nobles of the Imperial Court as lords of kokuga.
Yoritomo appeared as a flagman in revolts by samurai groups in the eastern countries, who originally served as court nobles of the Imperial Court as lords of kokuga.

sen.j: しかし平家打倒の治承・寿永の乱を経て、寿永2年/治承7年（1183年）に後白河天皇から東国における統治権的支配権（東海道・東山道の実質的支配権）を認める寿永二年十月宣旨を与えられる。
sen.e: After the Jisho Juei Revolt, he was given Juei-ninen Jugatsu no Senji (notes bringing down the orders from the Emperor and the Great Council of State) by Emperor Goshirakawa in 1183, which included the sovereignty authority (effective control of Tokaido and Tosando) in the eastern countries.

After the Jisho Juei Revolt, he was given Juei-ninen Jugatsu no Senji (notes bringing down the orders from the Emperor and the Great Council of State) by Emperor Goshirakawa in 1183, which included sovereign authority (effective control of Tokaido and Tosando) over the eastern countries.

After the Jisho Juei Revolt, during which the Taira government collapsed, he was handed a Juei-ninen Jugatsu no Senji (a written decree from the Emperor and the Great Council of State) by Emperor Goshirakawa in 1183, which granted him sovereign authority (effective control of Tokaido and Tosando) over the eastern provinces.
sen.cmt: 文章の流れを修正しました。

sen.j: そして右近衛大将に任じられるがすぐに辞任し鎌倉に戻り翌建久2年（1191年）正月に前右大将として「政所吉書始」を行い家政機関を設置する。
sen.e: He was appointed Ukoneno-daisho (a position in the Ritsuryo system) but resigned the position soon, went back to Kamakura, and executed Mandokoro-kissho-hajime (the ceremony announcing the start of new official works) to establish domestic economy organizations as a Sakino-udaisho in January 1191.

He was appointed Ukoneno-daisho (a position in the Ritsuryo system) but soon resigned the position, went back to Kamakura, and executed Mandokoro-kissho-hajime (the ceremony announcing the start of new official works) to establish domestic economy organizations as a Sakino-udaisho in January 1191.

He was appointed Ukoneno-daisho (a position in the Ritsuryo system) but soon resigned the position, went back to Kamakura, and executed Mandokoro-kissho-hajime (the ceremony announcing the start of new official works) to establish domestic economy organizations as a Sakino-udaisho in February and March 1191.

sen.j: これが発展し鎌倉を本拠とした地方政権を樹立し、東国を中心に守護と地頭の設置を朝廷に認めさせる。
sen.e: Due to development of this system, he established a Kamakura-based local government and got the Imperial Court to allow him deploy provincial constables and lords of manors mainly in the eastern countries.

Due to development of this system, he established a Kamakura-based local government and convinced the Imperial Court to allow him to deploy provincial constables and lords of manors mainly in eastern countries.

Due to development of this system, he established a Kamakura-based local government and convinced the Imperial Court to allow him to deploy provincial constables and lords of manors mainly in eastern countries.

sen.j: その武家権力としての独立性を保つ機構を作るために近衛大将より格下の征夷大将軍に任ぜられ、その権力機構として幕府を開いた。
sen.e: To maintain the independence of the samurai authority, he was appointed seii taishogun, which was ranked below Konoe no daisho (Major Captain of the Palace Guards) and established a bakufu as an administrative structure.

To maintain the independence of the samurai authority, he was appointed seii taishogun, which was ranked below Konoe no daisho (Major Captain of the Palace Guards) and established a bakufu as an administrative structure.

To maintain the independence of the samurai authority, he was appointed seii taishogun, which was ranked below Konoe no daisho (Major Captain of the Palace Guards) and established a bakufu as an administrative structure.

sen.j: この時点ではまだ東国中心の地方政権であったが天皇・上皇と並ぶ武家権力が誕生した。
sen.e: At this stage, the bakufu was a local government mainly in the eastern countries, but a samurai authority that was comparable to the emperor and the retired emperor was born.
At this stage, the bakufu was a local government mainly in the eastern countries, but a samurai authority that was comparable to the emperor and the retired emperor was born.
At this stage, the bakufu was a local government mainly in the eastern countries, but a samurai authority that was comparable to the emperor and the retired emperor was born.

sen.j: 頼朝とその子らの源家は三代で滅びるが、御家人であった北条氏は、摂家から藤原頼経を迎えて将軍へと就任させ以後「宮将軍」を続け、自身は執権として政権を握る。
sen.e: Although Yoritomo and his children in the Minamoto family were perished in three generations, the Hojo clan, which was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), took FUJIWARA no Yoritsune from Sekke (line of regents and advisers) and give him a position of Shogun, and then maintained the position of miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) and gained the administrative power as a regent to the shogunate.

Although Yoritomo and his children in the Minamoto family perished in three generations, the Hojo clan, which was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), took FUJIWARA no Yoritsune from Sekke (line of regents and advisers) and give him the position of Shogun, and thus maintaining the position of miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) and gained administrative power as a regent to the shogunate.

Although Yoritomo and his children in the Minamoto family perished in three generations, the Hojo clan, which was gokenin (an immediate vassal of the shogunate in the Kamakura and Muromachi through Edo periods), took FUJIWARA no Yoritsune from Sekke (line of regents and advisers) and give him the position of Shogun, and thus maintaining the position of miyashogun (shogun from the Imperial Court) and gained administrative power as a regent to the shogunate.

sen.j: 幕府は承久の乱で鎌倉の武家権力が朝廷権力に勝利して、旧平家領にも守護地頭を起き支配権を全国に広げ、ついに初の全国統一の武家政権となった。
sen.e: The samurai authority in Kamakura defeated the Imperial Court authority in the Jokyu Revolt, and thus the bakufu deployed Shugo and Jito (military governor and estate steward) in the territory of the Taira family, spread their authority across the country, and established the first nationally-standardized military government eventually.

The samurai authority in Kamakura defeated the Imperial Court authority in the Jokyu Revolt, and thus the bakufu deployed Shugo and Jito (military governor and estate steward) in the territory of the Taira family, spread their authority across the country, and eventually established the first nationally-standardized military government.

The samurai authority in Kamakura defeated the Imperial Court authority in the Jokyu Revolt, and thus the bakufu deployed Shugo and Jito (military governor and estate steward) in the territory of the Taira family, spread their authority across the country, and eventually established the first nationally-standardized military government.

sen.j: そして次第に朝廷へ介入し、地頭は国衙領や荘園へ浸食し、武家政権は徐々に全国への支配を強めた。
sen.e: The bakufu gradually intervened in the Imperial Court and Jito eroded Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office) and Shoen, resulting in acceleration of its nation-wide governance by the military government.

The bakufu gradually intervened in the Imperial Court and Jito eroded Kokugaryo (territories governed by provincial government office) and Shoen, resulting in acceleration of its nation-wide governance by the military government.

tit.e: Period of the Northern and Southern Courts
Period of the Northern and Southern Courts
Period of the Northern and Southern Courts

sen.j: 南北朝時代 (日本)、後醍醐天皇らが鎌倉幕府を滅ぼして建武の新政を開始し、武家政権は中断する。
sen.e: In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, Emperor Godaigo and his people destroyed the Kamakura bakufu and started the Kenmu Restoration, and thus the military government was discontinued.
In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, Emperor Godaigo and his people destroyed the Kamakura bakufu and started the Kenmu Restoration, and thus the military government was discontinued.
In the period of the Northern and Southern Courts, Emperor Godaigo and his people destroyed the Kamakura bakufu and started the Kenmu Restoration, and thus the military government was discontinued.

sen.j: しかし新政は武家への恩賞施策と武家領地を減らし国衙領の復活を目指す後醍醐天皇の独裁と公家優先の政策で、武家の支持を得られずに混乱した。
sen.e: However, the restoration was dictatorial and Court noble-oriented policies of Emperor Godaigo who was trying to reduce reward measures for and territory of samurai families to restore Kokugaryo, which were not supported by the samurai families and made them confused.

However, the restoration was dictatorial and the Court noble-oriented policies of Emperor Godaigo who tried to reduce reward measures and territory of samurai families in order to restore Kokugaryo, were not supported by the samurai families and only served to confuse them.

sen.j: 足利尊氏が反旗を翻すと武家は結集し後醍醐政権を攻めた。
sen.e: As Takauji ASHIKAGA rebelled against the restoration, the samurai families got together and made an attack to the Godaigo government, and Emperor Godaigo ran away with the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family.

As Takauji ASHIKAGA rebelled against the restoration, the samurai families banded together and attacked the Godaigo government. Emperor Godaigo ran away with the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: 後醍醐天皇は三種の神器を持って逃げた。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo ran away with the Three Sacred Treasures of the Imperial Family.

sen.j: しかし尊氏は陸奥の北畠軍に敗北し九州に落ち延びる。
sen.e: However, Takauji was defeated by the Kitabatake forces in Mutsu and fled to Kyushu.
However, Takauji was defeated by the Kitabatake forces in Mutsu and fled to Kyushu.

sen.j: しかし勢力を盛り返し翌年に光厳天皇の院宣を掲げて入京。
sen.e: The following year, he regained his power and entered the capital with inzen (a decree from the retired Emperor) of Emperor Kogon.
The following year, he regained his power and entered the capital with inzen (a decree from the retired Emperor) of Emperor Kogon.

sen.j: 一時後醍醐帝と和解し持明院統の光明天皇を擁立（北朝 (日本)）して征夷大将軍に任ぜられた。
sen.e: He came to a composition with Emperor Godaigo temporarily, and then he supported and protected Emperor Komyo of the Jimyoin-to (the Northern Court) and thus was appointed seii taishogun, and later he established the Muromachi bakufu.

He came to a temporary understanding with Emperor Godaigo, where he supported and protected Emperor Komyo of the Jimyoin-to (the Northern Court) and thus was appointed seii taishogun. Later he established the Muromachi bakufu.

sen.j: 室町幕府を開いた。
sen.e: Later he established the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: そのため後醍醐天皇は再び武家権力との対立を深め、吉野に南朝 (日本)を開き南北朝二つの勢力に分かれて全国的な争乱の時代となる。
sen.e: Therefore, Emperor Godaigo recreated conflict with the samurai authority again and thus established the Southern Court in Yoshino, which marked the beginning of the nation-wide war between the Northern and Southern Courts

For this reason, Emperor Godaigo recreated conflict with the samurai authority again and thus established the Southern Court in Yoshino, which marked the beginning of the nation-wide war between the Northern and Southern Courts.

For this reason, Emperor Godaigo recreated conflict with the samurai authority again and thus established the Southern Court in Yoshino, which marked the beginning of the nation-wide war between the Northern and Southern Courts.

sen.j: 三代将軍足利義満の頃、南北朝は合一するが、事実上南朝の吸収である。
sen.e: The Northern and Southern Courts were unified when Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA was the third Shogun, but it was actually the Southern Court was taken over by the Northern Court.
The Northern and Southern Courts were unified when Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA was the third Shogun, but it was actually the Southern Court which was taken over by the Northern Court.
The Northern and Southern Courts were unified when Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA was the third Shogun, but it was in fact the Southern Court which was taken over by the Northern Court.
sen.cmt: actually -> "in fact" に変更しました。

sen.j: 南北朝のせいで混乱はしたが、しかし一説に南朝が一時存在したからその後天皇が継続する力になったという指摘がある。
sen.e: Although the period of the Northern and Southern Courts was a time of confusion, a theory says that the existence of the Southern Court made it possible for the successive Emperors to continue their authorities.

Although the period of the Northern and Southern Courts was a time of confusion, a theory says that the existence of the Southern Court made it possible for successive Emperors to continue on while possessing authority.

Although the period of the Northern and Southern Courts was a time of confusion, a theory says that the existence of the Southern Court made it possible for successive Emperors to continue on while possessing authority.

sen.j: 室町時代、三代将軍である足利義満は、朝廷からの権力簒奪による治天の君を目指し策謀を図り、中国の明から「日本国王」に冊封される。
sen.e: In the Muromachi period, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, schemed a conspiracy to obtain the position of Chiten no kimi (the retired emperor in power) by regaining the Imperial Court's power, and he got sakuho (homage by Chinese emperors) as "King of Japan" from Ming, China.

In the Muromachi period, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, hatched a conspiracy to obtain the position of Chiten no kimi (the retired emperor in power) by regaining the Imperial Court's power, and obtained sakuho (homage by Chinese emperors) as "King of Japan" from Ming, China.

In the Muromachi period, Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA, the third Shogun, hatched a conspiracy to obtain the position of Chiten no kimi (the retired emperor in power) by regaining the Imperial Court's power, and obtained sakuho (homage by Chinese emperors) as 'King of Japan' from Ming, China.

sen.j: さらに義満は叙任権、祭祀権や元号の改元、治罰の綸旨の封印など権限を奪っていき治天の権限を代行して天皇・朝廷の権威は史上最も低下した（『室町の王権』、『天皇家はなぜ続いたのか』今谷明）。
sen.e: Because Yoshimitsu usurped the Emperor and Imperial Court's authorities, including patronage, the right to hold a festa, change in era name, and sealing of jibatsu no rinji (imperial order to punish enemies), and carried out the Chiten authority, the Emperor and Imperial Court's authorities became lowest in the history ("Muromachi no oken (regal power of Muromachi)" and "Tenno-ke wa naze tsuduitanoka (Why has Emperor's family lasted?)" by Akira IMATANI).

Because Yoshimitsu usurped the Emperor and Imperial Court's authorities, including patronage, the right to hold a festa, change in era name, and sealing of jibatsu no rinji (imperial order to punish enemies), his ability to carry out to carry out actions under Chiten authority resulted in the lowest authority by the Emperor and Imperial Court in history ("Muromachi no oken (regal power of Muromachi)" and "Tenno-ke wa naze tsuduitanoka (Why has Emperor's family lasted?)" by Akira IMATANI).

Because Yoshimitsu usurped the Emperor and Imperial Court's authorities, including patronage, the right to hold a festa, change in era name, and sealing of jibatsu no rinji (imperial order to punish enemies), his ability to carry out actions under Chiten authority resulted in the lowest authority by the Emperor and Imperial Court in history ("Muromachi no oken" (regal power of Muromachi) and "Tenno-ke wa naze tsuduitanoka" (Why has Emperor's family lasted?) by Akira IMATANI).
sen.cmt: to carry out 重複削除"の位置

sen.j: その体制化として三男・足利義嗣の天皇即位を目指したがその前に義満の死亡で挫折する。
sen.e: To systematize the Yoshimitsu's ambition, he aimed to ascend Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, his third boy, to the Emperor; however, Yoshimitsu died before consummating his scheme and it ended up in failure.
To systematize Yoshimitsu's ambition, he aimed to ascend Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, his third boy, to the Emperor; however, Yoshimitsu died before consummating his scheme which ended in failure.
To systematize Yoshimitsu's ambition, he aimed to ascend Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA, his third boy, to the Emperor; however, Yoshimitsu died before consummating his scheme which ended in failure.

sen.j: また守護は、当初は国司の業務や地頭の権限への介入を禁じられていたが、応仁の乱以後の地方定住と権力の拡張の結果次第に領主化して室町後期には地方支配も進み、この頃の守護は守護大名と呼ばれる。
sen.e: At first, it was prohibited for shugo to intervene the tasks of Kokushi and the authorities of Jito, however, as a result of settlement in local areas and expansion of authorities after the Onin War, they gradually become feudal lords and cemented their grips in the local areas by the late Muromachi period; shugo in this period are especially called shugo-daimyo (Japanese territorial lords).

At first, it was prohibited for shugo to intervene in the tasks of Kokushi and the authorities of Jito, however, as a result of settlement in local areas and expansion of authorities after the Onin War, they gradually became feudal lords and cemented their grip in local areas by the late Muromachi period; shugo in this period are especially called shugo-daimyo (Japanese territorial lords).

At first, it was prohibited for shugo to intervene in the tasks of Kokushi and the authorities of Jito, however, as a result of settlement in local areas and expansion of authorities after the Onin War, they gradually became feudal lords and cemented their grip in local areas by the late Muromachi period; shugo in this period are especially called shugo-daimyo (Japanese territorial lords).

sen.j: 並行して室町幕府は地方政権化しそれにより15世紀中期からの国内統治は幕府・守護体制とよばれる。
sen.e: In parallel with this, the Muromachi bakufu adopted the local government system, and the administration of the nation after the mid 15th century is called the Bakufu-Shugo System.
In parallel with this, the Muromachi bakufu adopted the local government system, and the administration of the nation after the mid 15th century was called the Bakufu-Shugo System.
In parallel with this, the Muromachi bakufu adopted the local government system, and the administration of the nation after the mid 15th century was called the Bakufu-Shugo System.

sen.j: その後60年にわたり封印されていた治罰の綸旨は享徳の乱で復活し乱用されることになり天皇の権威復活の端緒となった。
sen.e: Jibatsu no rinji (imperial order to punish enemies), which was sealed off for about 60 years, was reactivated and then abused, which marked the resurgence of the Emperor.
Jibatsu no rinji (imperial order to punish enemies), which was sealed off for about 60 years, was reactivated and then abused, which marked the resurgence of the Emperor.
Jibatsu no rinji (imperial order to punish enemies), which was sealed off for about 60 years, was reactivated and then abused, which marked the resurgence of the Emperor.

sen.j: 戦国時代 (日本)、室町幕府や守護は国内統治権を失い、新たに台頭した戦国大名が多くの国を支配した。
sen.e: In the Sengoku Period, the Muromachi bakufu and shugo lost their authorities to rule the nation and daimyo (Japanese territorial lords) in the Sengoku period, who newly came to the forefront, ruled many countries.

In the Sengoku Period, the Muromachi bakufu and shugo lost their authorities to rule the nation and daimyo (Japanese territorial lords) in the Sengoku period, who newly came to the forefront, ruled many countries.

In the Sengoku Period, the Muromachi bakufu and shugo lost their authorities to rule the nation and daimyo (Japanese territorial lords) in the Sengoku period, who newly came to the forefront, ruled many countries.

sen.j: 武家権力は決定的な勢力となるがその一方で成り上がった戦国大名は朝廷から官位官職を受けて、権威や大義名分を得た。
sen.e: The samurai authority became a decisive power, but parvenu daimyo in the Sengoku period, on the other hand, received official rank and government post from the Imperial Court and obtained administrative power and legitimate reasons.

The samurai authority became a decisive power, but parvenu daimyo in the Sengoku period, on the other hand, received official rank and government post from the Imperial Court and obtained administrative power and legitimate reasons.

The samurai authority became a decisive power, but parvenu daimyo in the Sengoku period, on the other hand, received official rank and government post from the Imperial Court and obtained administrative power and legitimate reasons.

sen.j: また大内氏の直奏による大宰大弐の獲得に始まる戦国大名の勢力拡大の実利目的の官職任免もされるようになった。
sen.e: Moreover, appointment and dismissal of the government post for utilitarian purposes to expand the power of the daimyo in the Sengoku period, starting from acquisition of Dazai-no-daini (the next seat position of Dazaifu) by direct report to the throne of the Ouchi clan, also began.

Moreover, appointment and dismissal of the government post for utilitarian purposes to expand the power of the daimyo in the Sengoku period, starting from acquisition of Dazai-no-daini (the next seat position of Dazaifu) by directly reporting to the throne of the Ouchi clan, also began.

Moreover, appointment and dismissal of the government post for utilitarian purposes to expand the power of the daimyo in the Sengoku period, starting from acquisition of Dazai no daini (the next seat position of Dazaifu) by directly reporting to the throne of the Ouchi clan, also began.

sen.j: 例えば、毛利氏が蘭奢待の切屑を天皇から下賜されるだけで狂喜するなど、コンプレックスの中で京風の公家文化も武家に浸透し天皇崇拝が強まった。
sen.e: The Kyoto-style court noble culture penetrated the samurai families and the adoration of Emperor became stronger in the complex, as seen in the fact that the Mori clan fell into raptures over receiving woodchip of ranjatai (a fragrant wood which is said to have the best aroma) from the emperor.
sen.cmt: 「コンプレックスの中で」という意味が良く理解できませんでした。仕方なく、直訳で訳出しております。
sen.e: The Kyoto-style court noble culture penetrated the samurai families and the adoration of Emperor became stronger in the complex, as seen in the fact that the Mori clan fell into raptures over receiving a woodchip of ranjatai (a fragrant wood which is said to have the best aroma) from the emperor.

The Kyoto-style court noble culture penetrated the samurai families and the adoration of Emperor became stronger in the complex, as seen in the fact that the Mori clan fell into raptures over receiving a woodchip of ranjatai (a fragrant wood which is said to have the best aroma) from the emperor.

sen.j: こうして武家の台頭の中で天皇の権威は新たな形で復興した。
sen.e: In this way, the authority of the Emperor was restored in a new style while the samurai families were gained power.
In this way, the authority of the Emperor was restored in a new style while the samurai families gained power.
In this way, the authority of the Emperor was restored in a new style while the samurai families gained power.

sen.j: これらの戦国大名の中から強大化した織田信長が室町幕府を滅ぼし、強力な中央集権の基礎（織田政権）を築いた。
sen.e: Nobunaga ODA, who grew in strength among these daimyo in the Sengoku period, defeated the Muromachi bakufu and formed the foundation of strong centralized system (the Oda government).
Nobunaga ODA, who grew in strength among these daimyo in the Sengoku period, defeated the Muromachi bakufu and formed the foundation for a strong centralized system (the Oda government).
Nobunaga ODA, who grew in strength among these daimyo in the Sengoku period, defeated the Muromachi bakufu and formed the foundation for a strong centralized system (the Oda government).

sen.j: 信長の後を継いで天下を統一した豊臣秀吉は、公家である近衛前久の猶子として関白宣下を受け、政権（豊臣政権）を成立させた。
sen.e: Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who was a successor for Nobunaga and dominated Japan, took the imperial proclamation to become kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) as a yushi (an old Japanese adoption system) of Sakihisa KONOE and assumed the reins of government (the Toyotomi government).

Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who was a successor to Nobunaga and dominated Japan, took the imperial proclamation to become kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) as a yushi (an old Japanese adoption system) of Sakihisa KONOE and assumed the reins of government (the Toyotomi government).

sen.j: 秀吉は忠実な天皇の侍大将として信長より前の室町幕府武家政権としての成果と文書体系をも覆し天皇にひれ伏した。(「武家と天皇」今谷 明)
sen.e: Hideyoshi reversed the achievement and document architecture of the military government in the Muromachi bakufu, which was even before the era of Nobunaga, and groveled at the Emperor's feet as a loyal samurai general of the Emperor ("Buke to Tenno (the Emperor and the Samurai)" by Akira IMATANI).

Hideyoshi reversed the achievement and document architecture of the military government in the Muromachi bakufu, which was even before the era of Nobunaga, and groveled at the Emperor's feet as a loyal samurai general of the Emperor ("Buke to Tenno (the Emperor and the Samurai)" by Akira IMATANI).

sen.cmt: セル87の翻訳者のコメントに合わせ、原文を修正。"の位置移動

sen.j: 次の徳川家康は吾妻鏡を手本とし清和源氏を称し、征夷大将軍の位に就き、江戸幕府を開いた。
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the shogun after Hideyoshi, claimed member of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) by following "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), assumed the post of seii taishogun, and established the Edo bakufu.
sen.cmt: (「武家と天皇」今谷 明)という部分は、むしろ前の文節に付くべきではないかと思いましたので、ここには訳出せずに、ひとつ前の文節の最後に訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the shogun after Hideyoshi, claimed member of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) by following "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), assumed the post of seii taishogun, and established the Edo bakufu.

Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, the shogun after Hideyoshi, claimed member of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan) by following "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), assumed the post of seii taishogun, and established the Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 江戸時代は264年間に渡って続き、幕府は朝廷を禁中並公家諸法度などにより統制した。
sen.e: The Edo period lasted for 264 years and the bakufu controlled the Imperial Court based on Kinchu narabini kuge shohatto (a set of regulations that applied to the emperor and the Kyoto nobles).
The Edo period lasted for 264 years and the bakufu controlled the Imperial Court based on Kinchu narabini kuge shohatto (a set of regulations that applied to the emperor and the Kyoto nobles).

sen.j: 地方政治は藩によって行われ、幕府と合わせて幕藩体制と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Local politics were conducted in each domain, which are, together with the bakufu, called the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate.
Local politics were conducted in each domain, which are, together with the bakufu, called the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate.
Local politics were conducted in each domain, which are, together with the bakufu, called the feudal system characteristic of the shogunate.

sen.j: 朱子学を盛んにし自らの権力安定と根拠をにする。
sen.e: Ieyasu put his efforts into Neo-Confucianism to stabilize his power.
sen.cmt: 「根拠をにする。」にするという部分は原文が誤っているものと思われます。加えて「主語は誰か」もこの文節だけからでは判断できず、「徳川家康」という解釈で訳出しております。また「根拠にする。」という意味も明確に理解できませんでした。仕方なく「朱子学を盛んにし自らの権力を安定させた」という訳出に致しました。
sen.e: Ieyasu put his efforts into Neo-Confucianism to stabilize his power.
Ieyasu put his efforts into Neo-Confucianism to stabilize his power.

sen.j: しかしその一方で戦国期に復興した天皇の権威は、鎌倉幕府を模範とした独立型の幕府としたはずなのに、世の中の安定と共に大日本史の編纂を契機にして江戸幕府の朝廷からの委任論が大きくなる。
sen.e: On the other hand, authorities of the Emperor, which were restored in the Sengoku period, once turned into an independent-type bakufu which was modeled on the Kamakura bakufu; however, along with the stability of lives and editing of the Great Japanese History, the delegation from the Imperial Court of the Edo bakufu became larger.
sen.cmt: この文章も全体として理解しづらく、仕方ないので、直訳的に訳出しております。
sen.e: On the other hand, authorities of the Emperor, which were restored in the Sengoku period, once turned into an independent-type bakufu which was modeled on the Kamakura bakufu; however, along with the stability of lives and editing of the Great Japanese History, the delegation from the Imperial Court of the Edo bakufu became larger.

On the other hand, authorities of the Emperor, which were restored in the Sengoku period, once turned into an independent-type bakufu which was modeled on the Kamakura bakufu; however, along with the stability of lives and editing of the Great Japanese History, the delegation from the Imperial Court of the Edo bakufu became larger.

sen.j: また武家権力による天下統一のため農地を基礎とする農本主義を選択せざるを得ず商業の隆盛による前期資本主義的社会の成立に財政徴税などの基本体制が対応できず幕府各藩とも大商人からの借入が拡大し破綻していく。
sen.e: Each domain of the bakufu ran into debt from large-scale merchants and eventually went broke because they had to select the agricultural fundamentalism on a basis of agricultural lands to rule the nation, in addition, the basic system such as tax collection for finance did not respond to the establishment of the lower capitalism society made up of flourishing of commerce.

Each domain of the bakufu ran into debt from large-scale merchants and eventually went broke because of their dependence on agricultural fundamentalism to rule the nation, in addition, basic systems such as tax collection, did not respond to the establishment of the lower capitalist society made up of flourishing commerce.

Each domain of the bakufu ran into debt from large-scale merchants and eventually went broke because of their dependence on agricultural fundamentalism to rule the nation, in addition, basic systems such as tax collection, did not respond to the establishment of the lower capitalist society made up of flourishing commerce.

sen.j: 商人はわずかな街の共益金負担のみで無税であった。
sen.e: Merchants did not have to pay tax except small amount of common service charge for his/her own town.
Merchants did not have to pay tax except a service charge for his/her own town.
Merchants did not have to pay tax except a service charge for his/her own town.

sen.j: 御用商人への御用金の納入や大名貸しの踏み倒しなどの軋轢はあったが武家権力が社会の変化に追いついていかない。
sen.e: The samurai authority did not catch up with the change in society, even though there were some struggles including payment of goyokin (the money the Edo bakufu charged temporarily on farmers and merchants) to each government contractor and failing to pay Daimyogashi (lending money to a daimyo with high interest).

The samurai authority was unable to catch up with the changes in society, even though there were some struggles including payment of goyokin (the money the Edo bakufu charged temporarily on farmers and merchants) to each government contractor and failure to pay Daimyogashi (lending money to a daimyo with high interest).

The samurai authority was unable to catch up with the changes in society, even though there were some struggles including payment of goyokin (the money the Edo bakufu charged temporarily on farmers and merchants) to each government contractor and failure to pay Daimyogashi (lending money to a daimyo with high interest).

sen.j: 江戸時代末期やがて幕府の財政的な傾きと共に尊皇論が広まっていく。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, with the financial downswing of the bakufu, sonnoron (the thought respecting the Emperors) gradually spread.
At the end of the Edo period, with the financial downswing of the bakufu, sonnoron (the thought respecting the Emperors) gradually spread.
At the end of the Edo period, with the financial downswing of the bakufu, sonnoron (the thought respecting the Emperors) gradually spread.

sen.j: 江戸時代末期になり、諸外国が幕府に開国を求めると、尊皇攘夷などの運動が盛んとなり、政情不安の中で、十五代将軍の徳川慶喜は大政奉還を行い、武家政権は終焉を迎えた。
sen.e: At the end of the Edo period, as many foreign countries requested the bakufu to open the nation to the world, movements such as Sonno Joi (slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners), and yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, the 15th Shogun, implemented Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) under the unstable political situation, resulting in end of the military government.

At the end of the Edo period, as many foreign countries requested the bakufu to open the nation to the world, movements such as Sonno Joi (slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners), and yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, the 15th Shogun, implemented Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) under the unstable political situation, resulting in the end of the military government.

At the end of the Edo period, as many foreign countries requested the bakufu to open the nation to the world, movements such as Sonno Joi (slogan advocating reverence for the Emperor and the expulsion of foreigners), and yoshinobu TOKUGAWA, the 15th Shogun, implemented Taisei Hokan (transfer of power back to the Emperor) under the unstable political situation, resulting in the end of the military government.

sen.j: ただし徳川家としての武家権力は残るが、やがて鳥羽・伏見の戦いに始まる徳川家を中心とする勢力と改革により復興した西日本の薩長土肥雄藩との内戦は朝廷による官軍となった薩長土肥側の勝利となる。
sen.e: The samurai authority as the Tokugawa family remained; however, some civil wars, starting from the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, were held between the force mainly consisted of the Tokugawa family and the Sacchodohi yuhan (the domains of Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa and Higo), a force of the western Japan which was restored by the reform, as a result, the Sacchodohi yuhan, which became a government army formed by the Imperial Court, defeated the force of the Tokugawa family.

The samurai authority remained in the form of the Tokugawa family; however, some civil wars, starting from the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, were held between forces mainly consisting of the Tokugawa family and the Sacchodohi yuhan (the domains of Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa and Higo), a force of the western Japan which was restored by the reform, as a result, the Sacchodohi yuhan, which became a government army formed by the Imperial Court, defeated the forces of the Tokugawa family.

The samurai authority remained in the form of the Tokugawa family; however, some civil wars, starting from the Battle of Toba-Fushimi, were held between forces mainly consisting of the Tokugawa family and the Sacchodohi yuhan (the domains of Satsuma, Choshu, Tosa and Higo), a force of the western Japan which was restored by the reform, as a result, the Sacchodohi yuhan, which became a government army formed by the Imperial Court, defeated the forces of the Tokugawa family.

sen.j: しかしこれは雄藩側も各藩の実務下級藩士勢力のクーデターという面を持っている。
sen.e: However, this war also had an aspect of a coup d'etat launched by the practicing lower class samurai of each domain for Yuhan.
However, this war also had an aspect of a coup d'etat launched by the lower class samurai of each domain for Yuhan.
However, this war also had an aspect of a coup d'etat launched by the lower class samurai of each domain for Yuhan.

sen.j: 以後の日本は明治政府が統治を行い、大名は華族、他の武士は士族とされ、武家は消滅していった。
sen.e: After that, the Meiji Government held the sovereignty, and accordingly, daimyo and other samurai were ranked the peerage and warrior class respectively, and samurai families disappeared.
After that, the Meiji Government held sovereignty, and accordingly, daimyo and other samurai were ranked as peerage and warrior class respectively, and samurai families disappeared.
After that, the Meiji Government held sovereignty, and accordingly, daimyo and other samurai were ranked as peerage and warrior class respectively, and samurai families disappeared.

sen.j: 武家の思想は、教育による家族制度の徹底化や徴兵制による軍事国家など明治近代日本に変化した形で生き残ってその後の日本を生み出す元になった。
sen.e: The ideology of samurai family remained in modern Japan of Meiji period in a form of rooted family system through education and garrison state based on the conscription system, which became a model for subsequent Japan.

The ideology of samurai families remained in modern Japan of the Meiji period in the form of a rooted family system enforced through education and a garrison state based on the conscription system, which became a model for later periods in Japan.

The ideology of samurai families remained in modern Japan of the Meiji period in the form of a rooted family system enforced through education and a garrison state based on the conscription system, which became a model for later periods in Japan.
